revised_title: Anatomy and Physiology of Doris: A Comprehensive Study
tldr: This article provides a detailed description of the anatomy and physiology of the Doris, a type of Nudibranchiate Mollusca. The authors examine various species of Doris and describe their digestive, reproductive, circulatory, respiratory, and nervous systems. They also discuss the sensory organs of Doris, including the auditory capsules, eyes, and olfactory organs. The study concludes that the high organization of Doris suggests that the genus will need to be divided into several groups.
